subject: Technology
title: Mechanical vs Electronic TV
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mechanical vs Electronic TV usable.

hook.text: Before electronic TV, mechanical television used a spinning disc with holes in it. The image was tiny and terrible.

buildup.text: Paul Nipkow invented the scanning disc in 1884. John Logie Baird built the first working mechanical TV in 1926.

discovery.text: Mechanical TV produced a flickering, low-resolution image about the size of a postage stamp. But it worked.

twist.text: Electronic TV, using cathode ray tubes, produced sharper images with no moving parts. Mechanical TV was obsolete within a decade.

climax.text: The battle between mechanical and electronic television mirrors every tech transition: the elegant solution eventually wins.

punchline.text: Spinning discs gave us TV first. Electronics made it actually watchable.

quiz.question: What was the main drawback of mechanical television?
options: It produced tiny, flickering, low-resolution images
